How to solve the audio synch issue in VLC:
This is what you do:
1. Go to preferences
2. Select Audio from the list, actually I think it is selected by default
3. Click the advanced checkbox in the lower lefthand corner
4. Enter the miliseconds you want to "desync" the audio in the box to your right - it's entitled Audio desynchronization compensation - if you want the sound to come before the picture is it originally put a minus in front of the number...

300ms will do.

VLC solution is brilliant never knew that one and simple but when playing off my Ext drive into TV or off disc cant do.. Have found a simple solution which works every time.
While your watching the movie rewind for a few seconds and then play.. this usually synchs the audio and video. If it doesnt work try it again. Have done it quite a few times.
Dont know how it works but it works.
Sometimes the synch problem can be created by yourself because you pause the movie or fast forward it which throws it out.. Once synched just play it out or do the above to resynch it.. Enjoy
